content.prompt: Which of the following is true of the mother's quoted speech (Paragraph 5)?

choices.label: The author expects the speech to be comprehensible enough to enable her to make a point about her mother's use of language.
The author uses the speech as an example of the way her mother talked when the author was young, not the way her mother talks now.
The author wants to suggest that it is her mother's accent, not her syntax, that makes her English difficult to understand.
The author is more interested in what her mother says in the speech than in the way she says it.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe components of the rhetorical situation - the exigence, audience, purpose, context, and message.
